meanings.definition: A group of people or vehicles arranged in a row.
meanings.sent1: The lineups of students waiting for the bus were orderly.
meanings.sent2: The lineups of cars at the traffic light seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent3: The lineups of ducks crossing the road caused a quack-tastic traffic jam.
meanings.sent4: The lineups of trees along the street created a natural green wall.
meanings.sent5: The lineups of colorful flowers in the garden made a beautiful display.

meanings.definition: A list of players or performers scheduled to participate in a game or show.
meanings.sent1: The coach carefully studied the lineups before the big game.
meanings.sent2: The lineups for the concert were eagerly anticipated by the fans.
meanings.sent3: The lineups for the talent show were full of surprises and hidden talents.
meanings.sent4: The lineups for the play were like a cast of characters coming to life.
meanings.sent5: The lineups for the dance competition showcased a variety of styles and skills.
